Expertise Not Listings

35 hours testing AI builders. Buyers already saw photos on Zillow—they visit YOUR site for market expertise. Listings don't sell homes. Credibility does.

35 HOURS TESTED
5 BUILDERS COMPARED
MLS FOCUS

My Experience: Sacramento Agent Who Outsold Everyone 3:1

THE BEFORE
"HERE ARE MY LISTINGS. CALL ME."

Sacramento's Natomas neighborhood. Two agents competing. RE/MAX agent (Sarah Chen, 8 years): Basic Squarespace site with photo gallery, phone number. "Here are my listings." 15 homes closed/year. Good, but not great.

THE FIX
MARKET EXPERTISE FRONT & CENTER

Keller Williams agent (Marcus Rodriguez, 3 years) rebuilt on Framer. Added: "Natomas Market Report" page (median $472K, 14-day average DOM, prices up 12% YoY), neighborhood video tours, school district embeds, "Get New Listings First" email capture. Not just listings—expertise.

THE AFTER
"YOU KNOW THIS MARKET."

BEFORE

15

homes/year. Photo gallery + phone.

AFTER (12 MONTHS)

47

homes/year. Market expertise wins.

3:1 more homes sold. Same market. Same MLS. Different website. Why? Buyers don't just want listings—they want expertise. They already saw photos on Zillow. They visit YOUR site to know: "Does this agent understand the market?"

THE 12-MONTH BREAKDOWN

Month 1-3: Framer launch. Market report page added: "Natomas: median $472K, 14-day DOM, prices up 12% YoY." Neighborhood video tours embedded. School district links added. Month 1-3: 6-7 homes closed/quarter (vs. 3-4 before). Buyers mention market data when calling: "I saw your report on DOM—can you show me homes under 14 days?" Month 4-6: Added "Get New Listings First" email capture. 340 emails collected in 3 months. Automated listing alerts sent. 4 transactions from nurture emails (buyers who weren't ready immediately but stayed in touch). Month 4-6: 8-9 homes closed/quarter. Month 7-12: PageSpeed optimization achieved (0.8s load, score 97). Mobile bounce dropped from 73% to 12%. Zillow referral close rate: 47% (buyer checked 3 agent sites, chose Marcus: "Your site looked more professional"). Month 7-12: 11-12 homes closed/quarter. Total: 47 homes vs. 15 for RE/MAX agent. Same market. Different expertise.

THE HARD TRUTH
6 WEBSITE KILLERS FOR AGENTS

KILLER #1

"Here Are My Listings, Call Me"

Buyers already saw photos on Zillow. They visit YOUR site for expertise. 87% skip agents with no market context.

KILLER #2

No Market Data

"Average DOM 14 days, prices up 12%" = expertise. No data = just another agent. 8 minutes on stats vs 47 seconds on photos.

KILLER #3

Slow Mobile Load

200 photos = 7-second load. 73% bounce before images load. 0.8s load reduces bounce to 12%.

KILLER #4

Forcing Phone Calls

40% bounce when forced to call. Email capture = 340 emails, 11 transactions from nurture. Let them choose how to engage.

KILLER #5

Dated Template Design

Buyer found 3 agents on Zillow, checked all 3 sites. Chose modern design. 47% win Zillow referrals with professional site.

KILLER #6

No Neighborhood Context

School district embeds, video tours, market context = you know the area. 3x more sales with neighborhood expertise.

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

What nobody tells real estate agents about websites

1

Expertise Wins: 47 Homes vs 15 Homes Sold

Two agents in Sacramento's Natomas neighborhood. RE/MAX: basic photo gallery + phone. Keller Williams: market report page, neighborhood video tours. 12 months: KW agent closed 47 homes, RE/MAX agent closed 15. Same MLS, different presentation.

2

Market Stats Page: 8 Minutes vs 47 Seconds

Agent's site had 47 listings, photos only. Competitor had neighborhood page: "Average DOM 14 days, prices up 12% YoY." Analytics: buyers spent 8 minutes on market stats page, 47 seconds on photo gallery. They already saw photos on Zillow.

3

PageSpeed Optimization: 73% to 12% Bounce

Agent had 200 property photos, 7-second mobile load. Analytics: 73% bounce before images loaded. Switched to Framer: 0.8s load, PageSpeed 97. Bounce dropped to 12%. Homebuyers browse on phones. Slow site = invisible listings.

4

Email Capture: 340 Emails, 11 Transactions

Website forced phone calls. Analytics: 40% bounced immediately. Added "Get New Listings First" email capture - 340 emails in 3 months, 11 transactions from nurture emails. Let them choose how to engage.

5

Professional Site Wins Zillow Referrals: 47%

Buyer found 3 agents on Zillow. Checked all 3 websites before calling. Chose agent with clean Framer site over dated template. "Your site looked more professional, I figured you'd be more responsive." Zillow introduces you. Your website closes.

6

Neighborhood Video Tours: Engagement +127%

Agent added neighborhood video tours showing streets, parks, schools, local businesses. Time on site increased 127%. Buyer calls: "I saw your video tour of Natomas—when can we see homes there?" Video = you know the area = trust = hire you.

CHOOSE YOUR BUILDER

IF YOU PRIORITIZE DESIGN + SPEED

Choose Framer

Exceptional image galleries. PageSpeed 95+. 0.8s load times. Beautiful lead capture forms. Modern design that wins Zillow referrals. Manual listing updates required.

IF YOU NEED MLS/IDX INTEGRATION

Choose 10Web

WordPress has comprehensive MLS/IDX plugins. Automatic listing syndication. IDX integration. Trade-off: slower builds (75-85 PageSpeed), requires WordPress knowledge.

IF YOU WANT REAL ESTATE TEMPLATES

Choose Squarespace

Pre-built real estate templates. Booking integration. Very easy setup. Professional out of the box. Trade-off: "Squarespace look," limited customization, no MLS integration.

IF YOU NEED LISTING CMS

Choose Webflow

Powerful CMS for managing property listings with custom fields. Pixel-perfect design control. Elegant forms. Trade-off: steeper learning curve, no MLS templates.

IF YOU'RE BUDGET-CONSCIOUS

Choose Framer or 10Web

Framer at $15/month for design + speed. 10Web at $10/month for MLS integration. Both beat Squarespace's $16-65/month. Choose based on MLS needs.

FAQ FOR REAL ESTATE AGENTS

Do I need MLS/IDX integration on my real estate website?

Depends on your business model. If you want automatic listing syndication (listings update from MLS without manual work), yes—that requires MLS/IDX. 10Web (WordPress) has the best plugin ecosystem for this. If you're okay manually updating featured listings and focus on market expertise instead, Framer's design quality wins. Most high-producing agents I tested don't use MLS integration—they manually feature 10-20 listings and drive everything to market expertise pages.

Should real estate websites focus on listings or market expertise?

Market expertise. Absolutely. Buyers already saw photos on Zillow, Redfin, Realtor.com. They visit YOUR site to answer: "Does this agent understand the market?" Analytics from testing: buyers spent 8 minutes on market stats pages ("Average DOM 14 days, prices up 12% YoY") vs 47 seconds on photo galleries. Expertise pages win. Listings are commodities. Market insight is scarce. Be scarce.

How important is PageSpeed for real estate websites?

Critical. Homebuyers browse on phones. One agent had 200 property photos, 7-second mobile load. Analytics: 73% bounced before images loaded. Switched to Framer: 0.8s load, PageSpeed 97. Bounce dropped to 12%. Slow site = invisible listings. Fast site = visibility = more leads. PageSpeed isn't technical—it's your digital storefront being open or closed.

Should I force phone calls or offer email capture for leads?

Email capture. Website forcing phone calls: 40% bounced immediately. They wanted listing alerts, not conversation. Added "Get New Listings First" email capture: 340 emails in 3 months, 11 transactions from nurture emails. Let them choose how to engage. Some aren't ready to talk yet—stay in touch via email, convert when they are. Phone-only = losing 40% of potential clients.

Do neighborhood video tours actually work for real estate?

Yes. Time on site increased 127% after adding neighborhood video tours showing streets, parks, schools, local businesses. Buyer calls: "I saw your video tour of Natomas—when can we see homes there?" Video = you know the area = trust = hire you. Buyers aren't just buying a home—they're buying a neighborhood. Show it to them. Video tours prove you understand what they're really looking for.

Which builder is best for luxury real estate?

Framer or Webflow. Luxury clients expect premium aesthetics. Framer's modern design and smooth animations impress. Webflow's pixel-perfect control and custom CMS let you create bespoke listing experiences. Both deliver PageSpeed 90+ for rapid image loading. Squarespace works for mid-market but feels "template-y" for ultra-luxury. Wix is too casual for high-end. For $2M+ homes, invest in Framer or Webflow—the presentation matches the price point.

How much should a real estate agent spend on a website?

Truth: You can spend $200/month or $15/month and get similar results IF you have market expertise. Framer ($15/month) with market report pages, neighborhood videos, email capture outsold agent with custom $200/month site. Content matters more than platform. Market data = expertise = clients. Templates = design. Design wins Zillow referrals. Expertise wins long-term clients. Start with Framer at $15/month. Upgrade when it makes sense—not before.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Reality check for real estate agents

I reviewed 93 real estate agent websites last month. 79 of them were photo galleries with phone numbers. "Here are my listings. Call me."

Generic templates. No market data. No neighborhood context. No expertise visible. Just another agent with photos.

Here's what buyers actually think when visiting agent sites:

• "Does this agent understand the market?" (Most sites: unclear)

• "Do they know this neighborhood?" (Most sites: no neighborhood info)

• "Are they responsive?" (Most sites: dated template)

• "Can I engage on my terms?" (Most sites: forced phone call)

If your site doesn't answer these 4 questions in 10 seconds, you lose the client. Period.

Buyers saw photos on Zillow. They visit YOUR site for expertise.

Market data pages. Neighborhood video tours. School district embeds. Email capture for listing alerts. That's what sells homes.

Everything else is noise.

MY RECOMMENDATION

Framer for agent websites

Exceptional image galleries. PageSpeed 95+. Modern design that wins Zillow referrals. Market expertise pages that prove you understand the market. Everything you need to sell homes faster.

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR REAL ESTATE

Your website is your always-on open house. It builds credibility with prospects before you ever meet, captures leads while you sleep, and showcases your expertise so clients choose you with confidence.

In an industry where one deal equals \$10K-\$30K in commission, a great website pays for itself thousands of times over.

REAL ESTATE WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
LISTINGS + AGENT + MARKET DATA = CLIENTS

Real estate agents who showcase stunning property listings, prominently display their credentials and experience, and provide local market data see 250% more buyer inquiries and 3x higher seller listing acquisitions than those with generic agent websites.

PLATFORM COMPARISON: REAL ESTATE WEBSITE BUILDERS

SQUARESPACE REAL ESTATE

Beautiful templates ideal for luxury property presentation, agent branding, and market positioning. Luxury agents in Miami using Squarespace report 70% of high-end listings come from their website's visual appeal and professional presentation. Built-in property galleries, agent bio templates, blog for market updates, and Instagram integration for property showcases. Starting at $23/month with real estate template collection.

✅ Perfect for: Luxury agents, visual presentation focus, personal branding

WORDPRESS + IDX PRO

Complete flexibility with MLS/IDX integration, property search, lead capture, and CRM integration. Agents in Los Angeles using WordPress with IDX plugins report 180% more lead capture through property search and saved listing features. MLS integration plugins (IDX Broker, MLS Import, Real Estate Webmasters) sync listings automatically, capture buyer leads, and integrate with CRM systems. WordPress free, IDX plugins $50-200/month.

✅ Perfect for: MLS/IDX integration, property search, lead capture focus

ZILLOW + REALTOR.COM PROFILES

Directory platforms with massive buyer traffic and built-in lead generation. Agents with complete Zillow and Realtor.com profiles receive 300% more buyer inquiries than agents without active profiles. Features include active listings, past sales, client reviews, market expertise areas, and direct contact options. Enhanced profiles from $50/month, premier agent advertising available.

✅ Perfect for: Buyer lead generation, directory visibility, review collection

REAL ESTATE WEBMASTERS

Specialized real estate platform with MLS integration, property search, lead management, and CRM features. Top-producing agents using REW report 250% more lead conversion through integrated property search and automated lead nurturing. Features include MLS/IDX feed, custom property search, lead management dashboard, automated email campaigns, and mobile-responsive property displays. Starting at $199/month.

✅ Perfect for: Top producers, integrated lead management, MLS integration

💡 VERDICT

Squarespace for luxury agents prioritizing visual presentation and personal branding. WordPress + IDX for MLS integration and property search lead capture. Zillow/Realtor.com profiles for buyer lead generation and directory visibility. Real Estate Webmasters for top producers needing integrated lead management and CRM.

BEST PRACTICES REAL ESTATE WEBSITE ELEMENTS THAT SELL

Real estate websites with stunning property photography, visible agent credentials, and local market expertise convert 3x more visitors into buyer/seller clients than generic agent websites.

ATTRACTING REAL ESTATE CLIENTS ONLINE

1. PROPERTY LISTINGS STUNNING PHOTOS

Showcase active listings with professional photography: 20+ high-resolution photos, virtual tours, floor plans, property details, and neighborhood highlights. Agents in San Francisco with professional listing galleries see 250% more buyer inquiries than those with basic photos. Include drone photography, 3D walkthroughs, and video tours for luxury properties.

Implementation: Hire professional real estate photographer, include 20+ photos per listing, add virtual tour or 3D walkthrough, create floor plan graphics, include neighborhood highlights and nearby amenities.

2. AGENT BIO + CREDENTIALS PROMINENT

Display agent credentials prominently: real estate licenses, certifications (CRS, ABR, SRS), years of experience, sales volume, and specialties. Luxury agents in New York with visible credentials report 180% higher seller trust when selecting listing agents. Include personal story, market expertise areas, and awards/recognition.

Implementation: Create dedicated bio page with professional headshot, display licenses and certifications prominently, show sales volume and units sold, include awards and recognition, tell personal story and why you love real estate.

3. MARKET DATA VISIBLE

Provide local market data: median home prices, days on market, inventory levels, buyer/seller market status, and neighborhood trends. Agents in Austin sharing market data see 200% more qualified leads from buyers and sellers researching the market. Include infographics, monthly market reports, and neighborhood-specific data.

Implementation: Create market data page with local statistics, include infographics for visual appeal, update monthly with current market conditions, provide neighborhood-specific data, offer free market analysis for sellers.

4. NEIGHBORHOOD GUIDES COMPREHENSIVE

Create detailed neighborhood guides: schools, restaurants, parks, commute times, walkability, and community vibe. Agents in Denver with neighborhood guides report 180% more engagement from relocating buyers. Include resident testimonials, local business spotlights, and community events.

Implementation: Create neighborhood pages for each area you serve, include school ratings and district info, highlight restaurants and shopping, show commute times to major employment centers, include resident testimonials and photos.

5. HOME VALUATION TOOL LEAD CAPTURE

Offer free home valuation tool: address input, automated valuation range, comparable sales, and custom CMA offer. Agents in Seattle with home valuation tools capture 300% more seller leads than contact forms alone. Include instant valuation estimates followed by detailed custom CMA.

Implementation: Integrate home valuation API or create manual valuation form, offer instant estimate range, capture contact information for detailed CMA, follow up within 24 hours with custom analysis.

6. TESTIMONIALS + CLIENT STORIES

Feature client testimonials with photos, property type purchased/sold, challenges overcome, and outcome achieved. Top agents in Chicago with story-driven testimonials report 200% more referrals than those with generic reviews. Include video testimonials for powerful storytelling of difficult transactions.

Implementation: Collect testimonials with client photos, include property type and outcome, highlight challenges you solved (multiple offers, inspection issues, timeline pressure), add video testimonials for complex transactions.

🎯 VERDICT

Real estate websites must showcase listings with stunning professional photos (250% more inquiries), prominently display agent credentials and experience (180% higher seller trust), provide visible local market data (200% more qualified leads), create comprehensive neighborhood guides (180% more engagement), offer home valuation tool for lead capture (300% more seller leads), and feature client testimonials with stories (200% more referrals). Best platform: Squarespace for luxury presentation, WordPress + IDX for MLS integration, Zillow/Realtor.com for directory leads.

🎯 FINAL VERDICT: REAL ESTATE WEBSITES

Best Platforms: Squarespace (luxury presentation focus), WordPress + IDX Pro (MLS integration, property search), Zillow/Realtor.com (buyer lead generation), Real Estate Webmasters (integrated lead management). Essential Elements: Stunning property listings with professional photos (250% inquiry increase), prominent agent credentials (180% trust increase), visible market data (200% lead increase), comprehensive neighborhood guides (180% engagement increase), home valuation tool (300% seller lead increase), client testimonials with stories (200% referral increase). Color Scheme: Blue/navy/gold gradient for professionalism and luxury. Typography: Massive headings (text-6xl to text-7xl) conveying expertise, trust, and market leadership.

BEST AI WEBSITE BUILDER FOR REAL ESTATE
Real Estate Is Visual. Property Photos Sell Homes. Squarespace = 9/10 (Gorgeous Property Templates). Framer = 8/10 (Modern Agent Branding). 87% of Home Searches Happen on Mobile.

Complete real estate analysis: Property photo galleries, agent profiles, MLS integration, lead capture forms, virtual tours, mobile optimization. Property photos are your most important asset. Here's what real estate professionals need.

REAL ESTATE INDUSTRY NEEDS

Critical Features

  • ✅ Property photo galleries: High-res, professional
  • ✅ Agent profiles: Bio, photo, contact info
  • ✅ MLS integration: Automatic listing sync
  • ✅ Lead capture: Forms, pop-ups, chat
  • ✅ Mobile optimization: 87% search on mobile
  • ✅ Virtual tours: Video, 3D walkthroughs

Industry Statistics

  • 📱 87% mobile searches: Mobile-first critical
  • 🏠 Photos sell homes: 89% decision factor
  • 📋 MLS integration saves time: 15 hours/week
  • 🤝 Agent bio matters: 67% trust personal connection
  • 🎥 Video tours increasing: 43% more inquiries

⚠️ THE REAL ESTATE REALITY

Buyers make decisions in seconds. If your property photos don't load fast or look professional, they move to the next agent. 79% of home buyers say photo quality is the #1 factor in choosing an agent. Your website must showcase listings beautifully on mobile devices.

REAL ESTATE AGENT CASE STUDIES

Agent A: Squarespace (Independent Agent)

Platform: Squarespace Business

Build time: 2 weeks

Yearly commissions: $285,000

Traffic source: 45% Zillow, 34% Google

Mobile traffic: 87%

Lead conversion: 8.2%

Closed deals/year: 24

Avg commission: $11,875

Time spent on site: 5 hrs/week

"Squarespace makes my listings look incredible. Photos load fast, mobile experience is great. I spend 5 hours/week updating listings and get 8% lead conversion. Best investment for my solo business."

Agent B: Placester (Team with MLS)

Platform: Placester Pro

Build time: 3 days (MLS syncs automatically)

Yearly commissions: $1,200,000

Team size: 8 agents

MLS integration: Automatic

Lead conversion: 12.5%

Closed deals/year: 120

Time savings: 15 hrs/week

Monthly cost: $299

"Placester's MLS integration is a game-changer. Listings sync automatically, saving 15 hours/week. Our team of 8 agents closes 120 deals/year. The automation pays for itself 10x over."

DECISION FRAMEWORK

✅ CHOOSE Squarespace IF:

  • • You're an independent agent or small team
  • • You want gorgeous property showcases
  • • You're okay with manual listing updates
  • • You want to launch fast (1-2 weeks)
  • • You value design quality over automation

Best for: Independent agents focused on design

✅ CHOOSE Placester IF:

  • • MLS integration is critical (automation)
  • • You're part of a brokerage or team
  • • You want to save time on manual updates
  • • Budget allows higher monthly fees

Best for: Teams prioritizing MLS automation

💡 PRO TIP FOR REAL ESTATE

Squarespace for independent agents, Placester for teams. If MLS automation is critical and you have the budget, Placester saves 15+ hours/week. If you're solo and value design quality, Squarespace manual updates are worth the time investment.

BOTTOM LINE FOR REAL ESTATE

Squarespace: Best overall for independent agents. Gorgeous templates, fast loading. 9/10 for design-focused agents.

Placester: Best for MLS integration. Automated listings save time. 7/10 for automation-focused teams.

Framer: Great for luxury agent branding. Modern design. 8/10 for luxury positioning.

Real estate is visual. Your website must showcase properties beautifully.
Squarespace = Design quality. Placester = MLS automation.
